page.title: 11Shouldham-Where we live.
page.content: There has been a lot of building n Shouldham,mostly bungalows,and quite a lot of refurbishing of places like the Old Butcher's shop,public houses, Bakery and Blacksmith's. In Shouldham Thorpe new building has been less,most families living in cottages which once belonged to Hall Farm. Most families have installed central heating but retain the open fire, there being no gas in the villages,but a ready supply of wood for stoves. Some of our homes have now fitted double glazing as an energy saver but also to lessen the noise of aircraft from Marham.Kitchens have changed with the advent of automatic washing machines, microwave cookers and automatic dish washers. Many of our homes now have colour television and video recorders.
